text: José S Carrión (Jumilla 1962) is a Spanish scientist, editor, science and cultural columnist and poet. His main research interest deals with the relationships between hominins and plants from a palaeoecological perspective. He has conducted and co-ordinated a number of research projects on the palaeoflora and palaeovegetation of the Iberian Peninsula and Balearic Islands, ecological changes linked to patterns and processes of human and cultural evolution, eco-cultural collapses, extinctions in plants, palaeoecology and biodiversity conservation and forest management, palaeoenvironments of arid regions, pollen analysis of biogenic materials and archaeological sites, pollen analyses of honeys, aerobiological monitoring (Burkard filters), forensic palynology, and spore and pollen-morphological studies. He is full professor of Evolutionary Botany at University of Murcia, where he leads the Research Group ECCE HOMO (Evolution, Cenozoic, Quaternary, Ecology, Homo).University of Murcia. Grupo de Investigación E005-11 He is currently editor in chief of Review of Palaeobotany and Palynology, and Associate Editor of Quaternary Science Reviews, Elsevier. == Education == University of Murcia: 1985. BSc Biology. Special Distinction. 1986: MSc Botany, Palynology. 1990: PhD Palynology. Cum Laude and Special Distinction. He has been manager at the National Research Plan, Biodiversity Program in the Spanish Ministry of Economy, and participated in a number of international committees of evaluation of research activities. == Publications == === Articles === Carrión,s publications * 1992 # Carrión JS. 1992. Servicio Publicaciones de la Universidad de Córdoba. == Poetry == Author of the book Hipocampo (Poemas). == Dystonia == José S Carrión has been known in the neurological community for his success to deal with dystonia, a rare neurological disorder. He was treated through the Dr. Joaquín Farias technique. == References == == Other websites == * Official website * https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCq0W0ROuORGH-4ZgHHCDb4A?view_as=subscriber Dissertation to the King of Spain on the occasion of the opening of the university course(https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SPyy7c0czao) Category:1962 births Category:Living people Category:Spanish scientists Category:Spanish writers Category:People from the Region of Murcia
title: José S Carrión
